findings.title: Royalties.sol: Missing validations can cause loss of funds
findings.description: The function `updateAddress()` is missing important validations, allowing the owner to overwrite existing royalty addresses and potentially lose funds forever.

findings.title: Auction with active lots can be removed or updated
findings.description: The function `removeAuction()` and `updateAuction()` do not check if there are any existing active Lots. Any such removed auction will lock the token transferred to it permanently.

findings.title: NFT.sol:Token transfer restrictions can be bypassed
findings.description: The token transfer restrictions implemented in NFT.sol can be easily bypassed by interacting with safeTransferFrom() and safeBatchTransferFrom() functions inherited from ERC1155.sol contract.

findings.title: NFT.sol: Missing Event Emission
findings.description: The function `_changeOwner()` does not emit an event, even though a change of ownership should be looked at according to a TODO comment.

findings.title: NFT.sol Token owner is not updated in all transfers
findings.description: The methods `safeTransferFrom` and `safeBatchTransferFrom` inherited from the `ERC1155` contract are exposed as public methods and can be called by anyone to transfer the token, which does not update the current owner in the `NFT` contract.

findings.title: NFT.sol Duplicate tokens can be minted for invalid basic token
findings.description: The function `batchDuplicateMint()` does not validate whether the base token is a valid one or not, allowing the duplicate minter to mint any token with an invalid base token id, resulting in invalid creator address for those.
